title: Samuel P. Taylor Service Station
text:
The Samuel P. Taylor Service Station is a historic commercial building at 1123 West 3rd Street in <a href="Little%20Rock%2C%20Arkansas">Little Rock, Arkansas</a>. Built in 1938, it is an excellent example of a period automotive <a href="filling%20station">filling station</a> with <a href="Art%20Deco">Art Deco</a> styling. It is a single-story L-shaped structure, with three service bays set at different angles, and an office in front. A zigzag pattern of black tiles extends across the building's <a href="cornice">cornice</a>, and black tile is used prominently around the main entrance and below the office windows.
The building was listed on the <a href="National%20Register%20of%20Historic%20Places">National Register of Historic Places</a> in 2000.
